column4: Does anyone know exactly what LVM and EVMS are, what they do, and how I know if I'm using them, or need them?
afaik lvm is logical volume manager and I don't think Ubuntu (or any flavor thereof) uses it by default.
Well, EVMS is causing quite a delay on my bootup.  If I only have 4 major partitions on my HD - i.e., no logical partitions - can I remove them from bootup?
Toren: and according to Google EVMS is Eastern Virginia Medical School ;)
Oh dear... there's a school on my computer!
Toren: actually it's Enterprise Volume Management System I guess
Toren: do you have raid at all?

Toren: Did you install them manually? I don't think they're installed by default, so if they're installed on your system and you didn't install them manually they may have gotten installed for a reason
Hmmm. Then I'd be a bit leary about removing them just yet
you said you have four partitions?
tonren: does your system maybe have raid capability that you're just not using?
I doubt it.  Since when do mid-range laptops have RAID?
